title: Dented pot
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Dented_pot/zh-CN "Dented pot/zh-CN")

| \[   dented pot   [![Dented pot.png](/images/4/48/Dented_pot.png)](/wiki/File:Dented_pot.png) |                                      |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------ |
| Appearance                                                                                    | dented pot                           |
|                                                                                               |                                      |
| Slot                                                                                          | [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm")            |
| AC                                                                                            | [1](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class") |
| Special                                                                                       | *(none)*                             |
|                                                                                               |                                      |
| Base price                                                                                    | 8 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")      |
| Weight                                                                                        | [10](/wiki/Weight "Weight")          |
| Material                                                                                      | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")            |

A **dented pot** is a type of [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Origin](#Origin)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [6.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and used armor dealerships can sell helmets.

[Mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") have an effective 1⁄6 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a dented pot.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, a dented pot confers 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"). [Wearing](/wiki/Wear "Wear") or [removing](/wiki/Removing "Removing") a dented pot takes only one action.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Strategy

The dented pot provides the same base AC and protection from falling objects as the [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet"), but has 1⁄3 of the weight and can be put on or taken off more quickly.

## History

The dented pot first appears in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

In [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1") and earlier versions, including some variants based on those versions, dented pots and other armor that had no turn delay to wear did not have their enchantment revealed when worn as a result of a bugfix to prevent armor enchantment becoming known if the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") is interrupted while putting it on - this is fixed in [NetHack 3.6.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.2 "NetHack 3.6.2").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) NetHack 3.6.2 features a somewhat similar bug, where taking off a helm that had no turn delay (i.e. a [fedora](/wiki/Fedora "Fedora") or dented pot) will leave it stuck and take off the hero's body armor instead - this is fixed in [NetHack 3.6.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.3 "NetHack 3.6.3").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Origin

The dented pot's default [tile](/wiki/Tile "Tile") is based on [cookware pots](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cookware_and_bakeware "wikipedia:Cookware and bakeware"), which are commonly used as a form of improvised helmet in various types of media.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a dented pot produces an [orcish helm](/wiki/Orcish_helm "Orcish helm").

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a [tinfoil hat](/wiki/Tinfoil_hat "Tinfoil hat") can be created at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") by combining a [dunce cap](/wiki/Dunce_cap "Dunce cap") and a dented pot.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a dented pot can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") and a [war hammer](/wiki/War_hammer "War hammer"). A dented pot can be combined with a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") to create a helmet, and can be combined with an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger") to create an orcish helm.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 636](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L636): *1⁄2 chance if not generated with a helmet*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 354](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objects.c#L354): *Most other helms have a wear/remove delay of 1 turn*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [doc/fixes36.2 in NetHack 3.6.2, line 490](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.2_Release/doc/fixes36.2#L490)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [doc/fixes36.3 in NetHack 3.6.3, line 323](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.3_Released/doc/fixes36.3#L323)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Dented pot

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
[   dented pot  
Appearance dented pot
Slot helm
AC 1
Special (none)
Base price 8 zm
Weight 10
Material iron

A dented pot is a type of helm that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Origin
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
    • 6.2 SpliceHack
    • 6.3 EvilHack
  • 7 References

Generation

In addition to random generation, general stores and used armor dealerships can sell helmets.

Mercenaries have an effective 1⁄6 chance of being generated with a dented pot.[1]

Description

While worn, a dented pot confers 1 base AC. Wearing or removing a dented pot takes only one action.[2]

Strategy

The dented pot provides the same base AC and protection from falling objects as the helmet, but has 1⁄3 of the weight and can be put on or taken off more quickly.

History

The dented pot first appears in NetHack 3.1.0.

In NetHack 3.6.1 and earlier versions, including some variants based on those versions, dented pots and other armor that had no turn delay to wear did not have their enchantment revealed when worn as a result of a bugfix to prevent armor enchantment becoming known if the hero is interrupted while putting it on - this is fixed in NetHack 3.6.2.[3] NetHack 3.6.2 features a somewhat similar bug, where taking off a helm that had no turn delay (i.e. a fedora or dented pot) will leave it stuck and take off the hero's body armor instead - this is fixed in NetHack 3.6.3.[4]

Origin

The dented pot's default tile is based on cookware pots, which are commonly used as a form of improvised helmet in various types of media.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, upgrading a dented pot produces an orcish helm.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, a tinfoil hat can be created at a furnace by combining a dunce cap and a dented pot.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, a dented pot can be created at a forge by combining a knife and a war hammer. A dented pot can be combined with a dagger to create a helmet, and can be combined with an orcish dagger to create an orcish helm.

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 636: 1⁄2 chance if not generated with a helmet
  2. ↑ src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 354: Most other helms have a wear/remove delay of 1 turn
  3. ↑ doc/fixes36.2 in NetHack 3.6.2, line 490
  4. ↑ doc/fixes36.3 in NetHack 3.6.3, line 323

A '''dented pot''' is a type of [[helm]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
In addition to random generation, general [[store]]s and used armor dealerships can sell helmets.

[[Mercenaries]] have an effective {{frac|6}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a dented pot.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|636|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment={{frac|2}} chance if not generated with a helmet}}

==Description==
While worn, a dented pot confers 1 base [[AC]]. [[Wear]]ing or [[removing]] a dented pot takes only one action.{{refsrc|src/objects.c|354|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Most other helms have a wear/remove delay of 1 turn}}

==Strategy==
The dented pot provides the same base AC and protection from falling objects as the [[helmet]], but has {{frac|3}} of the weight and can be put on or taken off more quickly.

==History==
The dented pot first appears in [[NetHack 3.1.0]].

In [[NetHack 3.6.1]] and earlier versions, including some variants based on those versions, dented pots and other armor that had no turn delay to wear did not have their enchantment revealed when worn as a result of a bugfix to prevent armor enchantment becoming known if the [[hero]] is interrupted while putting it on - this is fixed in [[NetHack 3.6.2]].{{refsrc|doc/fixes36.2|490|version=NetHack 3.6.2}} NetHack 3.6.2 features a somewhat similar bug, where taking off a helm that had no turn delay (i.e. a [[fedora]] or dented pot) will leave it stuck and take off the hero's body armor instead - this is fixed in [[NetHack 3.6.3]].{{refsrc|doc/fixes36.3|323|version=NetHack 3.6.3}}

==Origin==
The dented pot's default [[tile]] is based on [[Wikipedia:Cookware and bakeware|cookware pots]], which are commonly used as a form of improvised helmet in various types of media.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[upgrading]] a dented pot produces an [[orcish helm]].

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], a [[tinfoil hat]] can be created at a [[furnace]] by combining a [[dunce cap]] and a dented pot.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], a dented pot can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[knife]] and a [[war hammer]]. A dented pot can be combined with a [[dagger]] to create a helmet, and can be combined with an [[orcish dagger]] to create an orcish helm.
